i think that's installing it some kind of advanced way.. find out the folders it put itself in and delete them or something. :P I try just finding .debs for everything so i can easily uninstall it with the synaptic package manager.
~/ is the same as "/home/username/". If you write ~/ in terminal, nautilus etc it will resolve it to your username's home path. :) It's nice.
